entry.title: How to send the notification mail for IEM once a day with the specified time
entry.content:
In FRUN system, we configured the calculating frequency of the alert for IEM(Integration & Exception Monitoring) as 1440 minutes (=24 hours) so that the alert notification is sent just once a day.
It is working fine - the alert notification is sent just once a day at around 10:50am.
Is it possible to change the time to 8:00am?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to send the notification mail for IEM once a day...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

The current design of FRUN doesn't provide the option for adjusting the time for sending an alerts.
 
The functionality you want is not provided by the SAP standard but you can try the following approach and test whether it works.
 
Basically, if the configuration of the alert was saved with a minor change (e.g. enter one more space in the alert name, etc.), it will trigger a new alert shortly thereafter.
So if you change the configuration and save it at around 7:55am, the new alert will be generated around at 8am.
However, as your configuration is already with 1440 minutes, there will be mostly data loss in the next alert instances if you just save the change around at 7:55am(or before).
 
Therefore, the better approach would be the below:

  1. Adjust the alert configuration and save it with a calculation frequency of 1265 minutes once the regular alert has been triggered at 10:55 AM.
    This adjustment will generate an additional alert shortly after the modification, capturing any new aborted jobs created between 10:55 AM and the configuration change.
    The subsequent alert will be triggered at approximately 8 AM the following day.
  2. After the alert is triggered around 8 AM the next day, revert the calculation frequency of the alert back to 1440 minutes and save the alert configuration around ~8AM (or else the next alert will be triggered 5:55am next day).
    This action will prompt one additional alert to be generated shortly thereafter capturing any new aborted jobs created between 8 AM and the configuration change.
    But this ensures all subsequent alerts are consistently triggered daily at approximately near to 8 AM.

Please test it and adjust it according your needs.

Hope above helps you.
Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: BP Relationship of Migration Object of Migration Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello @yukitsumura 

To clarify, the Customer (or Supplier) migration object in Migration Cockpit only loads the Business Partner with its roles and master data. However, it does not establish Business Partner Relationships, such as contact person links or BP–BP connections.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2502, there is currently no migration object available for BP Relationships. The supported options include:

Use the Business Partner Relationship API (API_BUSINESS_PARTNER_RELATIONSHIP) after migrating the BPs, or maintain the relationships manually in the Fiori apps (Maintain Business Partner, Manage Workforce).

https://api.sap.com/api/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER/resource/get_A_BusinessPartner

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: DEV System Refresh from PROD in RISE Private Cloud: Transporting ABAP Versions (130906) Feasible?
entry.content:
Hello,

We are planning to refresh our DEV system by copying from PROD, but we need to retain ABAP version management in DEV after the refresh.

SAP Note 130906 describes a process using R3trans to export the version repository before the refresh and import it afterward to preserve versions.

However, our landscape is on RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition. We have been told that this is not possible in RISE Private Cloud due to technical restrictions.

Therefore, I would like to ask:

1. Is it indeed not possible to perform version export/import (as recommended by Note 130906) during a DEV refresh from PROD in a RISE Private Cloud environment?
2. If it's not supported, is there an alternative approach recommended to preserve development versions during a system refresh on RISE Private Cloud?
3. Are there any official SAP statements, best practices, or notes regarding version management across system refreshes in RISE Private Cloud?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Expert Advice Needed – Recurring Job Setup in AFC for Month-End Close
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m seeking your advice on how to configure a recurring job in SAP Advanced Financial Closing (AFC) to run during the first five days of each month as part of the month-end close process.

For example, our client wants the task "Automatic Clearing – G/L Open Items" to run automatically during the first five days of every month. However, we do not see a standard option within AFC to define this task as a recurring job across multiple days.

Additionally, this task has a successor task – "Foreign Currency Valuation" – which must follow the same schedule (i.e., run after clearing, each day from Day 1 to Day 5 of the month).

We would like to understand how to achieve this requirement using standard AFC functionality. Specifically:

  • Is it possible to configure a single task to run daily over a defined date range (e.g., Day 1–5)?
  • How can dependencies be maintained across those days between the clearing task and the valuation task?

I appreciate your guidance and any best practices you can share.

entry.title: Everyday issues: There is no miracle or magic. SAP HANA database needs memory.
entry.content:
last updated: 2025-08-29

Why was this blog post created?
Countless times we are faced with the fact that the cause of a system performance problem is nothing more than an insufficient amount of "working memory".

Fact: SAP HANA needs memory. In case the available "working memory" is insufficient the system won't work properly. General performance issue occurs.
Rule of thumb: the recommendation from SAP is the "tables data" should not use more than 50 % of the available memory.
One stop shop about SAP HANA memory: Collected information about memory in context of SAP HANA

How to check/detect if SAP HANA is having a memory issue?

1. SAP GUI - Transaction Code - DBACOCKPIT (Load History) - some further examples can be found here

In the case of a healthy system, a system in a calm state (e.g. out of working hours or without load) shows a constant used memory value (max. 50% of the available memory). In this case "used memory" = "tables data". When system used actively next to the "tables data" we see "working memory" also. In this case "used memory" = "tables data" + "working memory". The "working memory" increase and decrease during the system usage. We can check the memory usage easily with "Load History" option, e.g. Last 7 Days or with Custom Selections, so we can have a high level overview about the memory usage in general.

There is no room for "working memory" because "tables data" use the majority of the available memory all the time.

2. 3284834 - SQL Statement Collection: "HANA_Configuration_Minichecks" report for SAP HANA

The most general report will contain further information about the issue. Number of low memory unloads (short-term) = 226380 and Memory reclaim activity (s / day) = 26154. These are outrageously high numbers.

|M0430|Number of low memory unloads (short-term)        |      |226380                                                     |0                   |X| 2127458|
|M0435|Number of shrink unloads (short-term)            |      |0                                                          |<= 1000             | | 2127458|
|M0437|Size of unloaded columns (% / day, long-term)    |      |29.24                                                      |<= 3.00             |X| 2127458|
|M0438|Memory reclaim activity (s / day)                |      |26154                                                      |<= 1200             |X| 1999997|
|M0439|Memory reclaim maximum duration (s)              |      |57                                                         |<= 60               | | 1999997|
|M0440|Topology shared memory utilization (%)           |      |1                                                          |<= 70               | | 1977101|
|M0445|Number of OOM events (short-term)                |      |5                                                          |<= 3                |X| 1999997|
|M0446|Number of OOM events per day (mid-term)          |      |6.71                                                       |<= 3.00             |X| 1999997|
|M0447|Number of alloc. limit OOM events (long-term)    |      |47                                                         |0                   |X| 1999997|​

3. 3330262 - SQL Statement Collection: "HANA_Memory_Overview" report for SAP HANA

The report makes it easy to identify database tables that are using the majority of memory.

What are the consequences?
When the database does not have enough memory to operate, it tries to resolve the situation, it performs "unloads" and "reclaim" activities. These operations are inherent to the functionality of a healthy system, but in the case of a system constantly struggling with memory problems, they result in a constant and never-ending loop. Continuous reclaim and unload activity results in continuous resource (e.g. CPU) usage. The unloading also could affect a database table(s) that should not be removed from memory because it is in general use, meaning it will be reloaded soon again.

What is the conclusion?
There is no miracle or magic. To handle the high memory footprint you have the following options:
1. Data Management of general tables and technical tables. Reference: 3348393 - Overview of the data management process in the context of SAP HANA
2. Increase the available memory in the system.

Other article
✍️ Where can I find knowledge and information belongs to SAP HANA?

Useful bookmark
🔖 2872774 – Bookmark of Frequently Asked Questions for SAP HANA
🔖 3311408 – Bookmark of SQL Statement Collection reports for SAP HANA
🔖 2658020 – List of SAP HANA SQL Error Codes

Do you have further questions?
Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have question or observation regarding the article.
Q&A link for SAP HANA: https://answers.sap.com/tags/73554900100700000996

Contribution
If you find any missing information belongs to the topic, please let me know. I am happy to add the new content. My intention is to maintain the content continuously to keep the info up-to-date.

Release Information

Release DateDescription

entry.title: Batch Specific UoM conversion functionality not working properly after production confirmation
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Please understand the business scenario and the configuration we have accordingly performed in SAP.

Configuration Path:
SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Logistics - General -> Batch Management -> Batch-Specific Material Units of Measure -> Product Quantities Conversion -> Define Calculation of Base Quantity from Product Quantity

As per business scenario, material Base UoM is Meter (M) and the material comes in 5 types of Length: 4 M, 4.5 M, 5 M, 5.5 M, 6 M.

We have considered these lengths in predefined fixed batches for the material along with year & month as nomenclature, as an example –

4.0M202508
4.50M202508
5.0M202508
5.5M202508
6.0M202508

Now, the material is produced in Pieces (PC) and production entry is booked in PC unit.

So, we have maintained PC as Batch specific UoM and for that batch characteristics BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC has been created where for each batch it’s Meter Per Piece conversion value is maintained, such that –

4.0M202508 -> BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC = 4.0 (meter per) PC -> 4.0 M = 1PC
4.0M202508 -> BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC = 4.5 (meter per) PC -> 4.5 M = 1PC
5.0M202508 -> BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC = 5.0 (meter per) PC -> 5.0 M = 1PC
5.5M202508 -> BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC = 5.5 (meter per) PC -> 5.5 M = 1PC
6.0M202508 -> BASE_M_TO_CONV_PC = 6.0 (meter per) PC -> 6.0 M = 1PC

Now before making any production confirmation, each batch conversion value is already maintained. After GR 101 confirmation is done in Entry UoM PC, the conversion should be taken from the batch characteristics value as per batch selected. Example –

If 4.0M202508 batch is taken for 10 PC confirmation, Entry Qty. should be 10 PC & base UoM qty should be 40 M.

If 4.5M202508 batch is taken for 10 PC confirmation, Entry Qty. should be 10 PC & base UoM qty should be 45 M.

This conversion was functioning properly initially, but all a sudden this issue started appearing that qty. conversion is not appearing properly, such that –

If 5.5M202508 batch is taken for 10 PC confirmation base UoM qty is coming 27.5 M instead of 55 M.

This is the main critical issue.

Also parallelly, sometime entry UoM qty. in PC is getting replaced with Base UoM qty. for the material.

 

Hope the issue is well explained.
Any help or guidance on the issue will be highly appreciated.

 

Regards,

Rahul Nath
Ph - 9775675543

SAP S/4HANA  MAN Production Planning (PP) MAN Batch Management

entry.title: calculate tax checkbox per line item within FB60
entry.content:
I am participating in an ECC 6.0 to S/4HANA replacement project, merged with business operation standardization within group companies.

When comparing system changes between the old/new systems at the screen level, from a user point of view, I often have difficulties judging if the change is caused by 

A. update of SAP functions, or

B. add-on configurations within the company (it requires some cost to examine such small topics within system design documents)

entry.title: Re: Evaluate my Internal Tool Against Syniti ADDM ( (SAP...
entry.content:
Hi @karthik1gobburu 

Thank you for your question.

  1. Yes, Syniti ADMM can be used with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Syniti’s Advanced Data Migration and Management (ADMM) solution is officially SAP Premium Certified and recognised as SAP’s partner data migration tool of choice for all S/4HANA transition scenarios, including RISE with SAP and Public Cloud Syniti solutions accessing SAP ECC and SAP S/4HANA: What is permitted?

In Public Cloud, it supports data migration by connecting to the Migration Cockpit’s HANA Cloud staging database and extracting data through OData services, often via Syniti Connect with Boomi for OData extraction skthelp.syniti.com.

  1. Can your internal migration tool replace Syniti ADMM?

From the standpoint of SAP-certified migration paths in Public Cloud, the SAP Migration Cockpit (pre-delivered by SAP) and SAP-certified partner tools (like Syniti ADMM) are the supported and endorsed approaches.

An internally developed tool cannot officially replace Syniti ADMM in Public Cloud migration scenarios because:

  • It is not SAP-certified as a solution extension.
  • Its use would fall outside SAP’s supported migration framework for Public Cloud.
  1. In What Parameters Does Syniti ADMM Add Value?

When evaluating whether your internal tool can match Syniti ADMM, consider how Syniti fares across the following key migration criteria:

  • SAP Certification and endorsement for Public Cloud migrations.
  • Connectivity options: Syniti integrates with Migration Cockpit staging DB and extracts via approved APIs (e.g., OData via Boomi)  Connecting to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Migration methodology: Syniti uses a “Data First,” knowledge-driven approach, with automation, repeatability, and quality controls  SAP S/4HANA Data Migration
  • Support and governance: As a certified solution, Syniti is backed by SAP support and roadmap alignment.

If you will like to position your internal tool, you will need to evaluate how it aligns on these parameters, even though a full replacement of Syniti ADMM in Public Cloud is outside SAP’s supported landscape.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Stop the Buzzword Circus: Real Impact Starts with Mobile
entry.content:
Let's be blunt. The term "digital transformation" has become a playground for charlatans, peddling expensive, multi-year projects with dismal success rates – often exceeding 70% failure. This isn't strategic evolution; it's "Buzzword Bingo," designed to extract capital without delivering tangible value. Many organizations dive in without a clear strategy, leading to wasted resources and frustration.

Meanwhile, the cost of clinging to outdated manual processes is staggering. American employees waste over nine hours a week on data entry, costing businesses a hefty $28,500 per employee annually. This isn't just about salary; it’s about errors – humans make 100-400 errors per 10,000 entries compared to the near-perfect accuracy of automated systems [8, 9]. These errors cascade into financial losses and operational bottlenecks.

The solution? A pragmatic approach centered on the mobile-first advantage. By leveraging smartphones and tablets for instant digital intake – think scanning forms with intelligent document processing (IDP) – we eliminate manual errors and unlock real "low-hanging fruit." This isn't about grand transformations; it’s about targeted digitalization that delivers immediate ROI. For example, field service apps using mobile data collection can boost efficiency and reduce errors by up to 70%. This isn't a futuristic fantasy; it’s a proven strategy for tangible results.

entry.title: Re: is there any relationship between an account assignme...
entry.content:
When you enter the account assignment category (e.g., K for cost center), SAP re-evaluates the tax code based on the access sequence defined in the tax condition type (typically TTX1).

Common Access Sequence fields are Material, Plant, Account Assignment Category, Region & Origin Country. So if your condition table includes Account Assignment Category as a key field, the system may override the PIR tax code (V3) with a new one (V1) based on the combination of material, plant, and account assignment.

To ensure that V3 (10%) remains the default tax code even after entering account assignment, you can:

1. Review and Adjust the Condition Table
Go to SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Taxes → Define Access Sequences. Check the access sequence used by TTX1. If it includes Account Assignment Category, either remove it from the access sequence, or create a new condition record for Account Assignment Category = K with tax code V3.

2. Create Specific Condition Records
Use transaction FV11 to create tax condition records for Material + Plant + Account Assignment Category = K → Tax Code = V3.

3. Check Tax Indicator in Material Master
Ensure the Tax Indicator for Material is set correctly in the material master (Purchasing view). This influences tax determination when PIR is not used.

A Best Practice tip is if you want consistent tax behavior regardless of account assignment, simplify your access sequence to exclude fields that cause variability (like AAC). But if you need different tax codes for different AACs, then condition records must be maintained accordingly.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition をデータリポジトリにした Document Grounding の設定手順
entry.content:
はじめに 

SAP の生成AIアシスタント Joule には、Document Grounding の機能が提供されています。これにより、社内の業務ドキュメントの内容を元に迅速で的確な回答を生成できるようになります。例えば、従業員が社内ポリシーやマニュアルについて質問した際、Jouleは大規模言語モデルの知識だけでなく、会社内に保存された関連ドキュメントの内容を参照して回答します。従来この Document Grounding 機能は Microsoft SharePoint をデータソースとしてサポートしていましたが、SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 上のコンテンツも参照可能になりました。SAP Build Work Zone 上のワークスペースのパブリックコンテンツ（全ユーザーに公開されたドキュメントやページ）をJouleの提供する回答のソース情報として利用できるようになるため、社内ナレッジをより活用した回答が期待できます。 

本記事では、SAP Build Work Zone をドキュメントリポジトリとして設定し、Jouleのドキュメントグラウンディングを有効化する手順を解説します。これにより SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition 内に格納したPDFやWordファイル、ナレッジベース記事などをインデックス化し、ユーザーの質問に対してそれらのファイルの内容に基づく回答を Joule が生成できるようになります。なお、本記事の読者は SAP BTP や SAP Build Work Zone の基本的な知識を有していることを前提とします。 

前提条件 

本手順を開始する前に、以下の準備が整っていることを確認してください。 

  • SAP BTP 環境と Joule のセットアップ: SAP BTP のグローバルアカウントおよびサブアカウントがあり、Joule のサブスクリプションが有効になっていること。 
  • SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: SAP Build Work Zone, advanced editionが利用可能で、サイトが初期セットアップ済みであること。 
  • アイデンティティと認証基盤: SAP Cloud Identity Services (Identity Authentication) でシングルサインオン基盤が整備され、Jouleと統合製品（SAP Build Work Zone）間でグローバルユーザーID（user UUID）が共有されていること。Joule導入時にIdentity Authenticationの信頼関係を設定済みであること。 
  • SAP Build Work Zone 管理者権限: SAP Build Work Zone の管理コンソールにアクセスでき、機能の有効化や設定変更を行える管理者ユーザーとしてログインできる。 

以上の前提を満たした上で、以下に示す手順に従って設定を行います。 

全体構成図 

公式なSAP Help Portalのセットアップガイドから、全体の俯瞰図を描いてみると以下のような形になると考えられます。
なお、こちらは個人的な見解であり、情報の正当性には細心の注意を払ってください。 

【随時、更新します】 

手順 

今回は下記のSAP Help Portalの手順に則った上でセットアップを進めていきます。 

GitHub上に手順をまとめたスクリプトを用意していますので、ぜひご活用ください。ただし、正確な手順はSAP Help Portalに準じます。 

まずは下記の通り、GitHub上のリポジトリをクローンしましょう。 

git clone https://github.com/watwatwhat/document-grounding-setup.git

下記コマンドを実行して、セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動しましょう。 

./main.sh

 このガイドは、インタラクティブに手順を実行することができるように設計されています。1~12までを順次選択しながら進んで行きましょう。 

 1. Document Grounding サービスの有効化 

まず、SAP BTP上で Document Grounding のサービスインスタンスを作成します。このサービスがJouleで社内ドキュメントを取り扱うための技術的な基盤となります。 

  1. まずはセットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、メニューから 「1. Create Document Grounding Instance」 を選択します。
  2. Document Groundingのインスタンスの名前やそこに追加するサービスインスタンスの名前を決めて入力しましょう。今回の例では、それぞれ「document-grounding-other」「sb-document-grounding-other」としています。この入力値に基づいてセットアップの指示が表示されるので、その通りに設定を行いましょう。 
    （該当する公式ドキュメント：SAP Help Portal: Configure User Authentication） 
  3. BTP Cockpitでサービスの作成: JouleをサブスクライブしているサブアカウントのBTP Cockpitにログインし、「Service Marketplace」を開きます。 サービス一覧から「Document Grounding」を検索し、該当のサービスを選択します。 サービスインスタンスの作成: 「作成(Create)」ボタンをクリックします。プランはデフォルト（通常は data-manager プラン）を選択します。 
  4. Instance Nameには、 先ほど設定したインスタンス名を入力します。（例: document-docgrounding-other）Runtime Environment（実行環境）は 「Other」 を選択してください。Plan（サービスプラン）は「data-manager」 を選択してください。入力後、「Create（作成）」を実行しインスタンスを作成します。 
  5. インスタンス作成後、一覧に表示された当該インスタンスを選択し、Service Bindingの作成を行います。「Create（作成）」ボタンをクリックします。サービスバインディングの名前も先ほど決めたものを入力しましょう。（例：sb-document-grounding-other） 
  6. 作成後、サービスバインディングの名前をクリックし、サービスバインディングのURL をコピーしてください。 
  7. これを先ほどの待機しているセットアップガイドスクリプトに標準入力します。このように入力された必要情報はローカルの設定ファイルに保存されるようになっています。 

2. Cloud Identity Services インスタンスの有効化 

次に、Document Grounding サービスへセキュアにアクセスするための SAP Cloud Identity Services のインスタンスの有効化設定をします。ここでは SAP Cloud Identity Services上にJoule用のXSUAAインスタンスを作成し、クライアント証明書を発行してDocument Groundingサービスへのアクセスに利用します。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「2. Create Cloud Identity Services Instance」 を選択します。 
  2. インスタンスの名前とサービスバインディングの名前を決め、出力された手順に従ってBTP Cockpitからインスタンスを有効化します。今回はそれぞれ 「cis-other」 と 「sb-cis-other」 という名前にしています。 

  3.  

    BTP Cockpit の Service Marketplace に戻り、「Cloud Identity Services」を検索して選択します。「create(作成)」 をクリックし、プランは 「application」、Runtime Environmentは 「Other」 を選択します。インスタンス名を先ほど決めた名前を入力します。（例: cis-other）入力が終わったら、「Next（次へ）」 をクリックしましょう。 

  4.  「パラメーター」 設定画面が表示されたら、以下のJSONを入力します。これによって、Document Grounding サービスとの紐付けが行われます。 

{ 
 "consumed-services": [ 
   { 
     "service-instance-name": "<Document Grounding インスタンス名>" 
   } 
 ] 
}
  • インスタンスが作成されたら、Service Bindings 部分にある 「Create（作成）」 ボタンより、サービスバインディングを作成します。 
  • 作成したCloud Identity Servicesインスタンスを選択し、「サービスキーを作成(Create Service Key)」します。サービスキー名先ほど決定したものを入力します。（例：sb-cis-other）サービスキー作成時に以下のパラメーターを指定します。これにより、このXSUAAインスタンスに紐づくOAuthクライアントのX.509証明書と秘密鍵が生成されます（有効期限365日)。
{ 
 "credential-type": "X509_GENERATED", 
 "validity": 365, 
 "validity-type": "DAYS" 
}

 

  • サービスバインディングが作成できたら、名前をクリックしてバインディングの内容を確認します。このうち、「clientid」 と 「authorization_endpoint」 の値をコピーします。 
  • セットアップガイドスクリプトに値を渡します。後ほどこの値を使ってCloud Identity Servicesからトークンを取得しますが、 その時に利用する値が設定ファイルに書き込まれて保存されました。 

 

 3. 証明書の作成 

上記Cloud Identity Servicesのサービスバインディングにより、認証に利用する証明書が発行されました。しかしこちらは改行文字の変換等の処理が必要です。このステップでは、その変換処理を行います。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「3. Create Certificate Files」 を実行します。これにより、credentials フォルダの配下に 「cis_certificate.cer」 と 「cis_key.key」 が作成されます。このファイルの内容を、それぞれCloud Identity Services のサービスバインディングに記載されている 「certificate」 「key」 の内容に書き換えてください。 

  2.  

    それぞれ記入が終わったら、「y」を入力して次に進みましょう。 

  3.  

    次に変換処理後の証明書と秘密鍵ファイルの名前をどうするかを尋ねられますが、特に理由がなければそのままEnterでデフォルトの無難な名前が設定されるようにしています。この変換後のファイルは「credentials_adjusted」 フォルダの配下に格納されるようになっています。 

     

4. Document Grounding APIへの接続をテスト 

これでDocument Groundingサービスへの操作を行う準備が整いました。まずは設定済みのドキュメント取り込みパイプラインを一覧表示するAPIを呼び出してみましょう。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「4. Get Access Token 」 を呼び出します。内部では、上記で用意した証明書ファイルと秘密鍵ファイルを用いて、Document Groundingサービス用のOAuthトークンを取得しています。下記のようなリクエストを送信しています。取得されたトークンは設定ファイルに保存されます。 
curl --request POST \ 
    --url https://<authorization_endpointのドメイン>/oauth2/token \ 
    --header "accept: application/json" \ 
    --header "content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \ 
    --data "client_id=<上でメモしたclientid>" \ 
    --data "grant_type=client_credentials" \ 
    --cert ./doc-grounding.crt \ 
    --key  ./doc-grounding.key
  • 続いてセットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「5. Test Document Grounding Endpoint 」 を実行しましょう。これにより現在設定されているパイプラインの一覧が取得できます。初回実行であれば何もパイプラインは存在しないはずなので、 [] という空配列が返ってきます。 

 

5. SAP Build Work Zone 側の外部統合に関する設定 

続いて、SAP Build Work Zone 側で Document Grounding との連携を行うための設定を行います。（該当する公式ドキュメント：SAP Help Portal: Integration With Document Grounding） 

  1. SAP Build Work Zone Advanced Editionの管理者として Admin Console にログインし、「Feature Enablement（機能の有効化）」 を開きます。 

  2.  

    まず、SAP Work Zone側で外部連携する際に使用するOAuthクライアントを作成します。「External Integration」 -> 「OAuth Clients」 に移動し、「Add OAuth Client」 より新規OAuthクライアントを作成します。 

  3.  

    適当な名前とIntegration URLを記入し、「Save」ボタンで保存します。今回は「Document Grounding OAuth Client」という名前および、本環境のJouleのURLをIntegration URLに入力しました。 

  4.  

    保存が完了したら、「View」ボタンをクリックして発行されたOAuth認証情報を確認しましょう。 

  5.  

    表示された「Key」と「Secret」をコピーしてください。 

  6.  

    次に、「Feature Management」 -> 「Features」 項目で 「Enable document grounding integration」 というオプションをオンにします。この設定を保存することで、SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition と Document Grounding サービス間の統合機能がシステム内で有効になります。この際、通信に利用するOAuth Clientは先ほど作成したもの（例：Document Grounding OAuth Client）を設定します。 
     

  7.  

    次に、SAP BTP のサブアカウントでこのS AP Build Work Zone のコンテンツにアクセスするための Destination を作成します。 Document Grounding サービスが SAP Build Work Zone 内のコンテンツにアクセスする際には、このDestination設定を経由します。BTP Cockpitの「Connectivity > Destinations」を開き、「新規作成(New Destination)」で以下のように設定します。なお、<DWS URL> は、Admin ConsoleのOverviewページから取得可能です。

プロパティ 

値 

Name 

任意の名前（例：DocumentGrounding_WZAdv） 

Type 

HTTP 

Description 

任意 

Proxy Type 

Internet 

URL 

<DWS URL>  

Authentication 

OAuth2ClientCredentials 

Client ID 

Admin Console で発行したOAuth Client の 「Key」 

Client Secret 

Admin Console で発行したOAuth Client の 「Secret」 

Token Service URL 

<DWS URL>/api/v1/auth/token 

Token Service URL Type 

Dedicated 

追加プロパティ 

値 

HTML5.DynamicDestination 

true 

SetXForwardedHeaders 

false 

HTML5.SetForwardedHeaders 

false 

 
 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトに戻って 「6. Configure Work Zone Integration」 を実行し、設定したDestinationの名前を渡します。 

 

 

6. SAP Build Work Zone 内のコンテンツのインデックス登録（パイプライン設定） 

最後に、Document Groundingサービスに対して SAP Build Work Zone コンテンツを取り込み登録（インデックス化）する処理を設定します。これはパイプラインと呼ばれるスケジュールされたデータ取り込みジョブの登録で、設定後は定期的（1日1回）にWork Zone上のドキュメントをクロールし、最新内容がJouleに取り込まれます。 

  1. セットアップガイドスクリプトを起動し、「7. Create Work Zone Pipeline」 を実行します。内部ではDocument Groundingサービスのエンドポイントに対し、先ほど取得したアクセストークンおよび証明書を用いてパイプライン作成APIを呼び出しています。以下のコマンドはその例です。  
curl --request POST \ 
    --url "<ドキュメントグラウンディングのサービスキーURL>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline" \ 
    --header "Authorization: Bearer <上で取得したaccess_token>" \ 
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ 
    --data '{ 
      "type": "WorkZone", 
      "metadata": { 
        "destination": "<前ステップで設定したDestination名>" 
      } 
    }' \ 
    --cert ./doc-grounding.crt \ 
    --key  ./doc-grounding.key

 

  •  

    無事処理が完了するとパイプラインIDが返されます。このIDにより、Document Groundingサービス上で SAP Build Work Zone コンテンツを取得するパイプラインジョブが管理されます。パイプラインの作成と同時に初回実行が行われ、SAP Build Work Zone内のパブリックコンテンツ（アップロードされたドキュメント等）が読み込まれ、ベクトルインデックスが作成されます。以降は1日1回の頻度でWork Zone側の更新を自動反映します。手動で最新化したい場合はパイプラインAPIで適宜再実行することも可能です。（後述） 

 

グラウンディングの準備とパイプラインの手動実行 

これでDocument Groundingの機能を利用して、Jouleに回答を生成させる準備が完了しました。最後に、実際にドキュメントを読み込ませた上で回答させてみましょう。 

  1. 今回はITセキュリティポリシーに関するサンプル文書を用意しました。こちらをSAP Build Work Zoneにアップロードしましょう。なお、現時点（2025/08/29）では、英語の文書に対してのみ、グラウンディングは動作するようです。 

  2.  

    SAP Build Work Zoneのコンテンツページより、アップロードを行います。 

  3.  

    また、このワークスペースの単位でも Document Grounding を有効化する必要があります。「Workspace Admin Settings」より設定に進みましょう。 

  4.  

    Document Grounding の部分のチェックボックスを有効化して、「Save」より設定を保存します。 

  5.  

    最後に、セットアップガイドスクリプトから「10. Trigger Pipeline」を実行して、パイプラインを手動実行します。 

  6.  

    パイプラインの実行状態は、セットアップガイドスクリプトの「8. Check Grounding Status」より確認できます。うまくGroundingの取り込みが完了していると、「INDEXED」という表記が確認できます。 

     

     

Document Grounding の実行 

最後に、Document GroundingをJouleから実行し、SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition上のコンテンツファイルの記述内容に基づいた回答が返ってくることを確認しましょう。 

  1. まずは上記の Document Grounding の設定を行う前の回答を見てみましょう。一般的な回答が返ってきており、詳細は管理者に問い合わせるように案内されます。 

  2.  

    そして、下記が設定を行った後の回答です。しっかりと社内文書に基づいて回答が生成されていることが確認できます。ちなみに、Sourcesからドキュメント名をクリックすると、SAP Build Work Zone内の対象文書のページに遷移することができます。 

     


まとめ 

以上の手順により、SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition に保存された社内ドキュメントをデータソースとして、Joule のドキュメントグラウンディング機能を設定できました。これにより、ユーザーがJouleに対して行う質問に対し、Work Zone内のファイル（PDFやWord文書など）の内容を根拠にした回答が生成されるようになります。たとえば社内規程集のPDFをWork Zoneにアップロードしパブリックに公開しておけば、Jouleに規程の詳細を尋ねた際にそのPDFから回答が引用されるようになります。 

社内ナレッジを有効活用することで、Jouleの回答精度向上や信頼性の高い情報提供が期待できます。ただし前述の通り、現在この機能ではドキュメントがテナント内の全ユーザーにとって参照可能な情報源となる点に留意し、公開して問題ない情報のみをアップロードしてください。機能拡張により将来的にはユーザー権限に応じた応答制御なども行われる可能性があります。 

最後に、設定に際して不明点があればSAPヘルプの公式ドキュメント（Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions内の 「Set Up Document Grounding」 節や、SAP Build Work Zone, advanced editionの「Integration With Document Grounding」ガイド）を参照してください。最新情報や制約事項が更新されている場合があります。本記事の手順を参考に、自社環境でJouleとWork Zoneを連携させ、社内文書に基づく高度なQ&Aシステムを活用してみてください。 

  

参考資料 

  • SAP Help Portal: Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions – Set up Document Grounding 
    https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/integrating-joule-with-sap/set-up-document-grounding 
  • SAP Help Portal: SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition – Integration With Document Grounding 
    https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-advanced-edition/sap-build-work-zone-advanced-edition/integration-with-document-grounding

entry.title: Handling Deep Insert with Navigation Properties in Fiori Elements Using annotation.xml and manifest.
entry.content:
I am using Fiori Elements' List Report and Object Page to create new data via API_PRODUCT_SRV using a POST request. Although I have created the data, I encounter an error because it seems necessary to also send the to_Description data. I am trying to send the following payload:

{
"Product": "DUMMY_PRODUCT",
"ProductType": "FERT",
"BaseUnit": "EA",
"to_Description": {
"Product": "DUMMY_PRODUCT",
"Language": "EN",
"ProductDescription": "test API"
}
}

When updating existing data, the Description field appears on the screen, but it does not appear during creation. So, I cannot include the "to_Description" data  in the payload. I believe this is because the Product does not yet exist, so the Description cannot be linked. Is this correct?

Since I am using a standard API, I would like to use annotation.xml and manifest.json instead of CDS View annotations to include to_Description data. How should I write these files?

entry.title: Re: Down payments for Non-Trade Supplier are not applicab...
entry.content:
Why this happens is because, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, Trade Suppliers are typically linked to purchase orders and goods receipt processes. Non-Trade Suppliers are used for indirect procurement or services, often without a PO. The Manage Down Payment Request app relies on purchase order integration and certain business catalogs that are not activated for Non-Trade scenarios. This is why the app doesn’t allow you to process down payments for Non-Trade Suppliers.

Below are some workaround options:

1. Use Supplier Invoice Request App
You can manually create a down payment request for Non-Trade Suppliers using the Supplier Invoice Request Fiori app. This bypasses the PO dependency and allows you to initiate the payment manually.

2. Post Down Payment Directly
If the invoice request route is too restrictive, you can use Post Outgoing Payments app to manually post a down payment. Then clear it against the final invoice when it arrives.

3. Custom Workflow or Extension
If this is a recurring business need, consider building a custom tile or workflow using SAP BTP or In-App Extensibility to replicate the down payment logic for Non-Trade Suppliers. This can include approval flows and audit tracking.

As a Best Practice suggestion, if your organization frequently processes down payments for Non-Trade Suppliers, it may be worth reviewing whether these suppliers could be reclassified or whether a hybrid process (e.g., dummy PO for tracking) could be introduced to align with standard functionality.

entry.title: Re: Production Process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Hello,

To prevent you get an additional and unwanted R100 on stock, you can use the app app 'Production Order without Material - Create' (trx. CO07). Here R01, R102, and R103 will be consumed, but there will be no goods receipt of R100, unlike with a regulare production order (Create Production Order - Co01).

In the end, the choice of which process works best for you is up to you (our your client). The GI and GR workaround is clean and simple, but doesn't support capacity planning, costing, etc. which the by-product scenario does.

They're both workarounds (since S/4 Public Cloud does not support a native disassembly process) and the choice is up to you which suits your case best.

Kind regards,
Rick

entry.title: Announcing the VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon
entry.content:
Following successful collaborations with SAP User Groups worldwide, we are pleased to announce that the SAP BTP Hackathon initiative is coming to the Netherlands. VNSG and SAP are partnering to host the first-ever VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon in the country

In a nutshell:

  • This event is open to all SAP customers, including both VNSG members and non-members
  • Customers can nominate a use case that demonstrates how they leverage SAP BTP capabilities to innovate and optimize their business processes
  • Coaches and the organization team will then select the participating teams to further develop their use case
  • Up to 3 finalists will showcase their solution during the Demo Jam at the VNSG and SAP annual event in March 2026, with the chance to win some cool prizes

Ronald Schippers, managing director of the VNSG, shared his thoughts on the event during preparation:

The VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon is the opportunity for our members to showcase their creativity and innovative strength through collaboration. It offers the chance to work together with SAP to transform innovative ideas into tangible solutions that make an impact — powered by SAP BTP.

At VNSG, our core values are “community” and “knowledge sharing.” That’s why this hackathon is not just about competition; it’s about building connections, fostering personal and professional growth, gaining new insights, and bringing innovation to life together — all while having a great time.

I warmly invite all our VNSG members to seize this opportunity: to innovate, to learn from SAP’s global and local experts, and to experience the true impact of innovation and community.

We can’t beat this intro, so we are not even going to try 😀

 

Details

SAP BTP is THE platform to integrate and extend SAP applications. In simple terms, if you were an artist, SAP BTP would be the colors and brushes you use to create your “masterpiece” or provide the needed “touch ups” to existing paintings, in a way that looks and feels as if the original artist had done it.

It’s used by customers, partners and SAP to innovate and optimize business processes while leveraging the latest and greatest cloud technology. From SAP Integration Suite to SAP Build to SAP HANA Cloud and everything in between, if your stakeholders have a question, SAP BTP is the answer.

The SAP BTP hackathon challenge will showcase how customers can use SAP BTP to adapt and optimize their business processes. But that’s not all!

Participants will also benefit from in-depth enablement sessions led by SAP product experts to help them through the ideation and build phases.

The participating customers, those who have had their use case selected for the SAP BTP hackathon, will also have access to expert coaches during their build phase. Coaches are there to make sure “no use case is left behind” 😉

Once the build phase is completed, customers will pitch their use case to a jury of SAP experts. The jury will choose 3 finalists based on different criteria, like business relevance, SAP BTP usage, innovation and vision, that will go on to demo their use case in front of a live audience at the annual VNSG and SAP event.

To show off your efforts, participating team members will get special badges added to their SAP Community profile. So, if you are not yet an SAP Community member, what are you waiting for?

 

To all NL SAP Customers

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to participate in the SAP BTP hackathon!

In short:

  1. Submit your use case 👉🏻 here by October 15
  2. (Selected customers) Build your prototype and prepare a short 5 to 10 min video including the business value, solution diagram and demo by December 10
  3. Get ready to pitch your demo in February 2026 in front of a panel of experts [exact dates to be confirmed]
  4. (Finalists) Compete in the Demo Jam in March 2026 at the VNSG and SAP annual event

In case you still need convincing, let me reiterate some of the perks:

  • Attend SAP BTP enablement sessions led by SAP experts for inspiration and knowledge.
  • Engage with the SAP ecosystem and get special badges to display on your profile. Don’t forget to create an account in the SAP Community
  • Get direct access to SAP BTP coaches to support you during your build phase.
  • Expand your SAP BTP knowledge and bridge the gap between business and IT.

In case you have any question on the event, please drop a comment below 👇🏻

 

Conclusion

Don’t be shy and join the fun. Brainstorm with your teams and bring your innovative ideas to life with SAP BTP 😉

entry.title: Re: calculate tax checkbox per line item within FB60
entry.content:
To your question, "Is the “Calculate Tax” checkbox in FB60 a SAP standard update?", the answer is YES, the “Calculate Tax” checkbox in line items of FB60 is part of the SAP standard update in S/4HANA. This enhancement was introduced to give users more granular control over tax calculation at the line-item level, especially in scenarios involving manual tax entry, gross/net methods, or mixed tax codes.

In ECC 6.0, tax calculation was typically handled at the header level or via implicit logic. S/4HANA has improved this by allowing users to explicitly toggle tax calculation per line item, which aligns with the broader user experience improvements and financial accuracy goals of the new platform.

So in your case, this checkbox is not a company-specific add-on, but a standard SAP UI enhancement.

To your next question, where to find out, SAP doesn’t always highlight minor UI changes in broad release notes, but there are several reliable sources to track these updates:

One is SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library
Next, SAP Help Portal  Portal. Choose your S/4HANA version (e.g., 2022, 2023) and navigate to Finance → Accounts Payable → Vendor Invoice Processing. Look for “What’s New” or “Feature Scope Description” documents.

To streamline your analysis:

  • Create a change log matrix comparing ECC vs S/4HANA screens.
  • Tag each change as “SAP Standard” or “Custom” based on findings.
  • Use SAP GUI scripting or Fiori trace tools to identify backend objects tied to UI elements—this helps confirm if a field is standard.

entry.title: Reconciliation Account selection in "Create Supplier Invoice" app (F0859)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

entry.title: Re: Make Custom Fields Read Only - S/4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Philipp,

thank you for your question.

Switching a custom field between editable and read-only in S/4HANA Public Cloud is unfortunately not a simple, one-click setting. The answer depends on a couple of important factors:

  • Type of custom field
    – whether it was created as a Key User Custom Field in the Custom Fields app, or as a Developer Extensibility Custom Field via ABAP development tools.

  • UI and OData technology of the standard app
    – whether the Fiori application is based on SEGW OData services, or on OData services exposed with service binding (RAP model).

These dimensions influence whether and how you can make a custom field mandatory, read-only, or invisible (either statically or dynamically).

The following blog provides the general overview and step-by-step guidance on how to determine to which category your app belongs and what options you have:
Custom Fields in S/4HANA: How to control field properties like mandatory, read-only, and visibility

For your specific case – Manage Sales Orders (Version 2) – this is a Fiori application based on OData service C_SALESORDERMANAGE_SRV, which belongs to the service binding / RAP category. This means field control is only supported if the app has been enabled for it.

Here is the detailed blog relevant for your scenario (Fiori UI based on OData services with service binding):
Key User Custom Fields in Fiori UIs based on OData services exposed with service binding

 

Please have a look, and if you’d like, I can walk you through the specific steps for your case.

Kind regards,
Diana

entry.title: Re: is there any relationship between an account assignme...
entry.content:
Hello @0uTY 

Indeed, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the account assignment category is essential for determining the tax code linked to a Purchase Order.

Understanding this influence is crucial, and here’s why you observe this behaviour:

Default Tax Code Logic,
Tax code proposal in PO comes from multiple sources:

    1. Purchasing Info Record / Material Master if available
    2. Configuration in SSCUI / CBC for tax determination, such as a country, tax procedure, and tax condition records
    3. Account Assignment Category and  GL Account → When you enter account assignment category K (Cost Center), the system derives the consumption GL account from account determination. That GL account may have different tax determination logic assigned to linked condition records, which is why your tax code Changes from V3 (10%) to V1 (5%).

Why does it change:
For consumable POs, the system meticulously validates tax determination against the expense account, not only the material or PIR. This thorough process ensures the accuracy of the tax code proposal after assigning the account assignment category.

How to keep 10% V3 as default:

    1. Check the tax determination configuration in CBC → SSCUI 101016 to Define Tax Code Determination Rules for country-specific settings.
    2. Review condition records transaction type Set Tax Codes per Account Keys assigned to the GL accounts that are triggered by account assignment K.
    3. If necessary, it's crucial to maintain the manual default tax code in the Purchase Info Record or override it manually in the PO if your business allows.

So yes, there is an indirect relationship: when you pick an account assignment, the system re-derives account determination and applies the tax code accordingly

SAP Documentation Reference:

  • KBA – Tax Code Determination in Purchase Orders (S/4HANA Cloud)
  • Scope Item J45 – Procurement of Direct Materials-SAP Learning 
  • Maintain Condition Record-SAP Help  

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: E-mail notification for PR approval not working
entry.content:
Some key areas you need to check are

1. Workflow Email Step Configuration
Go to SWDD and open the workflow template (e.g., WS20000077 for PR approval). Check if there's an explicit email step (Send Mail) configured after the approval task. If not, you’ll need to add a Send Mail step that triggers when the PR is ready for approval. SAP workflows don’t send emails automatically unless a mail step is defined.

2. Notification Settings in SWNCONFIG
Use transaction SWNCONFIG to configure Extended Notifications. Ensure the scenario for PR approval is active and includes Recipient type (user ID), Notification channel (email) and Schedule job to send notifications (SWN_SELSEN)

3. Background Job SWN_SELSEN
Check if the job SWN_SELSEN is scheduled and running. This job is responsible for sending out email notifications for workflow events.

4. SCOT Configuration (SAPconnect)
Go to SCOT and verify email domain is correctly configured. SMTP node is active. No errors in the send queue (SOST).

5. User-Specific Settings
In SU01, confirm email address is in the correct format. Communication method is set to INT (Internet). Also check SO16 and SO13 for default communication settings.

6. Fiori Notification Channel
Fiori notifications are separate from email. If you're using SAP Fiori Launchpad notifications, ensure the Notification Hub is active. The user has subscribed to the relevant notification types.

Finally, and importantly, if you want both Fiori notifications and email alerts, you’ll need to configure both channels independently. SAP doesn’t automatically mirror Fiori notifications to email unless explicitly set up via workflow or extended notification.
